spanish: Mi hijo cumplirá seis años el próximo mes.
Mi hijo cumplirá seis años el mes que viene.
english: My son will be six years old next month.

spanish: La Sra. White nos da una prueba todos los días.
english: Ms. White gives us a test every day.

spanish: ¿Cómo se dice libro en chino?
english: How do you say book in Chinese?

spanish: Cada una de las lecciones es importante.
english: Each of the lessons is important.

spanish: Querían estar solos durante una hora.
english: They wanted to be by themselves for an hour.

spanish: Apoyo la libertad de expresión.
english: I support freedom of expression.

spanish: Se me cayó el teléfono mientras jugaba al tenis.
english: I dropped my phone while I was playing tennis.

spanish: La tormenta ha retrasado su vuelo.
english: The storm has delayed their flight.
The storm has delayed your flight.

spanish: Estuvimos acampando unos días, pero ya estamos en casa.
english: We were camping for a few days, but we are home now.

spanish: Hemos estado acampando durante unos días, pero ya estamos en casa.
english: We've been camping for a few days, but we're home now.

spanish: ¿Cómo van las clases?
english: How are the classes going?

spanish: ¿Como estas?
english: How are you doing?
How are you?
How do you do?

spanish: ¿Cómo va todo?
¿Cómo va?
¿Cómo te va?
english: How is it going?
How's it going?

spanish: No hablo mucho, mis compañeros hablan más que yo.
No digo mucho, mis compañeros de trabajo hablan más que yo.
english: I don't say much, my coworkers talk more than I do.
I don't say much, my coworkers talk more than me.

spanish: Fue a su escritorio a buscar una engrapadora.
Fue a su escritorio a buscar una grapadora.
english: She went to her desk to get a stapler.
He went to his desk to get a stapler.

spanish: Hizo algunas preguntas difíciles, pero yo estaba preparado.
english: He asked some hard questions, but I was prepared.
He asked some tough questions, but I was prepared.

spanish: ¿La Sra. White nos dio tarea?
english: Did Ms. White give us homework?
Did Mrs. White give us homework?

spanish: Conduzco al trabajo todos los días.
english: I drive to work every day.

spanish: Juan ya me ha mostrado los alrededores.
english: John has already shown me around.

spanish: José tiene muchas ganas de ir a nadar a la playa.
english: Jose really wants to go for a swim at the beach.
Jose really wants to go swimming at the beach.

spanish: ¿Qué hay de comprar unas pizzas?
english: What about getting some pizzas?
What about buying some pizzas?

spanish: ¿Qué hay de comprar unas pizzas?
english: What about getting some pizzas?
What about buying some pizzas?

spanish: Ellas retrasaron el juego porque estaba lloviendo.
english: They delayed the game because it was raining.

spanish: Cuando me enteré, ya era demasiado tarde.
english: By the time I found out, it was too late.

spanish: Tenemos que entregar el formulario.
english: We have to hand in the form.

spanish: No puedo recoger a Anne hoy. ¿Puedes recogerla?
english: I can't pick up Anne today. Can you pick her up?

spanish: La profesora va a repartir los exámenes.
english: The teacher is going to hand out the exams.

spanish: ¿Podrías recoger a Michael?
english: Could you pick up Michael?

spanish: Pregúntale a tu hermano quién es ese jugador alto.
english: Ask your brother who that tall player is.

spanish: Si le roban su tarjeta de crédito, cancélela de inmediato.
english: If your credit card gets stolen, cancel it right away.

spanish: La carrera es de cien metros, que son más de 300 pies.
english: The race is one hundred meters, which is over 300 feet.

spanish: La piscina tiene cien metros, que son más de 300 pies.
english: The pool is one hundred meters, which is over 300 feet.

spanish: ¿Con qué frecuencia usa Arthur las redes sociales?
english: How often does Arthur use social media?

spanish: Necesito conectarme y revisar mi correo electrónico.
english: I need to go online and check my email.

spanish: Los enemigos estaban escondidos por toda la montaña.
english: The enemies were hidden all over the mountain.

spanish: ¿Te importaría cerrar la puerta?
english: Would you mind shutting the door?

spanish: La calefacción no funciona en mi apartamento.
english: The heat is not working in my apartment.

spanish: La calefacción se apagará sola.
english: The heating will turn off by itself.

spanish: Ben da una clase sobre cómo maquillarse.
english: Ben teaches a class on how to put on makeup.
Ben teaches a class about how to put on makeup.

spanish: ¿Qué gasolinera tiene los baños más limpios?
english: Which gas station has the cleanest restrooms?

spanish: El basurero está hecho de plástico.
english: The garbage can is made of plastic.

spanish: Mi esposo se mudará el próximo mes.
english: My husband will be moving next month.

spanish: ¿Saliste en año nuevo?
english: Did you go out on New Year's Day?

spanish: ¿Puedes por favor vestirte?
english: Can you please get dressed?

spanish: ¿Quien va a pagarlo?
english: Who is going to pay for it?

spanish: Dejamos la computadora portátil en el estante como de costumbre.
english: We left the laptop on the shelf as usual.

spanish: ¿Podemos ir a la tienda, por favor?
english: Can we go to the store, please?
Can we please go to the store?

spanish: Es hora de vestirse para la escuela.
english: It's time to get dressed for school.

spanish: Enviarán el cheque por correo.
english: They are sending the check by mail.

spanish: Vive en una casa grande.
english: He lives in a big house.

spanish: Te veo en el parque.
english: See you at/in the park.
phrases.detail: Both 'in the park' and 'at the park' are grammatically correct. However, they mean two different things. 'At the park’ means the person is at the area of the park. While 'in the park’ means more than the person is enclosed within the park.

spanish: El gobierno ha agregado un impuesto a los cigarrillos.
english: The government has added a tax on cigarettes.

spanish: ¿En qué calle está la zapatería?
english: What street is the shoe store on?

spanish: ¿A qué hora llega el avión?
english: What time does the plane arrive?

spanish: A qué sabe esto?
english: What does it taste like?

spanish: ¿A quién apoya tu hermano?
english: Who is your brother rooting for?

spanish: Marco me pisó el dedo del pie y fue muy doloroso.
english: Marco stepped on my toe and it was very painful.

spanish: ¿Cómo va el nuevo trabajo?
english: How is the new job going?

spanish: Hago mis operaciones bancarias en línea.
Hago mis operaciones bancarias por Internet.
english: I do my banking online.

spanish: Nosotros hacemos karaoke todos los sábados.
english: We do karaoke every Saturday.

spanish: Nosotros hacemos karaoke todos los sábados.
english: We do karaoke every Saturday.

spanish: Todos los restaurantes están cerrados.
english: All of the restaurants are closed.

spanish: ¿Puedo caminar a la librería desde aquí?
english: Can I walk to the bookstore from here?

spanish: Pregúntale a tu padre.
english: Ask your father.

spanish: ¿Qué restaurante está más cerca?
english: Which restaurant is closer?

spanish: Nosotras hicimos brunch en pascua.
english: We made brunch on easter.

spanish: Quiero escribir tan bien como John.
english: I want to write as well as John.

spanish: Tendrás éxito al aprobar el examen.
english: You will succeed by passing the exam.

spanish: El equipo tuvo éxito al crear un nuevo plan.
english: The team succeeded by creating a new plan.

spanish: El estado logró crear un mercado.
english: The state succeeded in creating a market.

spanish: Tuvo éxito durante la entrevista por hablar de sus habilidades.
english: He succeeded during the interview by talking about his skills.

spanish: Tiene mucho conocimiento sobre educación.
english: He has a lot of knowledge about education.

spanish: No sé cuál era el coche de ellos.
english: I don't know which car was theirs.

spanish: No sé cuál era su coche.
english: I don't know what his car was.

spanish: No sé cuál era tu coche.
english: I don't know what your car was.

spanish: El espectáculo ya ha comenzado.
english: The show has already begun.

spanish: El espectáculo ya ha comenzado.
english: The show has already begun.

spanish: Iré a copiar su pasaporte.
english: I will go and copy your passport.

spanish: ¿El hotel tiene una piscina cubierta?
english: Does the hotel have an indoor pool?

spanish: Regresó de su baja por enfermedad todavía luciendo un poco cetrina.
english: She returned from her sick leave still looking a bit sallow.

spanish: Esa niña debería dejar de reírse de los monos.
Ese niño debería dejar de reírse de los monos.
english: That kid should quit laughing at the monkeys.

spanish: Le dije que dejara de dar comida a los patos.
english: I told him to quit giving food to the ducks.

spanish: Le dije que dejara de alimentar a los patos.
english: I told her to stop feeding the ducks.

spanish: El pueblo está al norte de la frontera.
english: The town is north of the border.

spanish: La aldea está al sur del país.
english: The village is south of the country.

spanish: El perro se estresa cuando escucha la alarma.
english: The dog gets stressed when he hears the alarm.

spanish: El coche se averió, así que llegamos tarde.
english: The car broke down, so we arrived late.

spanish: Necesito dinero para hacer un viaje este mes.
english: I need money to take a trip this month.

spanish: Suele hacer un viaje en verano.
english: He usually takes a trip in the summer.

spanish: Rosa hace un viaje a África todos los años.
english: Rosa takes a trip to Africa every year.

spanish: Al final del camino, deténgase y gire a la izquierda.
english: At the end of the road, stop and turn left.

spanish: ¿Hay algunas ciudades grandes allí?
english: Are there any big cities there?

spanish: Fumar adentro no es seguro.
english: Smoking indoors is not safe.

spanish: Ha parecido un poco aburrido desde que renunció al trabajo.
english: He has seemed a bit bored since he quit the job.
He has seemed a bit bored since he resigned from the job.

spanish: Quiero un trabajo de medio tiempo que pague cuarenta dólares la hora.
english: I want a part-time job that pays forty dollars an hour.

spanish: Ella es chef de tiempo completo en este restaurante.
english: She is a full-time chef at this restaurant.

spanish: Estoy postulando a un trabajo de tiempo completo.
english: I am applying for a full-time job.

spanish: Estoy postulando a un trabajo de tiempo completo.
english: I am applying for a full-time job.

spanish: ¿Alguien renunció el año pasado?
english: Did anyone quit last year?

spanish: Los fuegos artificiales comenzarán al atardecer junto al palacio.
english: The firework will start at sunset by the palace.

spanish: John se lastimó cuando luchó contra el león.
english: John got hurt when he fought the lion.

spanish: Alguien ha dejado un arma sobre la mesa.
english: Someone has left a gun on the table.

spanish: Alguien dejó su periódico en la oficina.
english: Someone left their newspaper in the office.

spanish: Esa persona dijo que el periódico era suyo.
english: That person said that the newspaper was theirs.
That person said the newspaper was theirs.

spanish: Ellas podrían ir a la cárcel.
Ellos podrían ir a la cárcel.
english: They could go to jail.
They might go to jail.

spanish: Estará en la corte el lunes.
english: He will be in court on Monday.

spanish: Ellas están en la corte hoy.
Ellos están en la corte hoy.
english: They are in court today.

spanish: A la gente le gusta vivir aquí porque no hay mucha criminalidad.
english: People like living here because there isn't much crime.
People like living here because there is not much crime.

spanish: La espía irá a la cárcel por 15 meses.
english: The spy will go to jail for 15 months.

spanish: ¿Por qué no recuerdo?
english: Why don't I remember?

spanish: Pensándolo bien, creo que iré después de todo.
english: On second thought, I think I'll go after all.

spanish: Es demasiado tacaño para dar dinero a la caridad.
english: He is too stingy to give money to charity.

spanish: Es una persona confiable.
english: He is a reliable person.

spanish: Ella tiene una tez clara.
english: She has a fair complexion.

spanish: Ella tiene una tez suave y pálida.
english: She has a smooth, pale complexion.

spanish: Su rostro estaba cubierto de pecas.
english: Her face was covered with freckles.

spanish: Mi papá tiene muchas arrugas en la cara.
english: My dad has many wrinkles on his face.

spanish: Tengo muchas arrugas en la cara.
english: I have many wrinkles on my face.

spanish: ¿A quién amas más?
english: Who do you love the most?

spanish: El cabello de mi hermana es naturalmente ondulado.
english: My sister's hair is naturally wavy.

spanish: Suele llevar el pelo recogido en una trenza.
english: She usually wears her hair in a braid.

spanish: He lavado los platos.
english: I have done the dishes.

spanish: Lavé los platos.
english: I did the dishes.

spanish: Al principio estaba tranquila, pero comencé a preocuparme.
english: I was calm at first, but I started to get worried.

spanish: Hemos tenido problemas, pero ahora son cosa del pasado.
english: We have had problems, but they are in the past now.

spanish: El archivo es demasiado grande para adjuntarlo a mi correo electrónico.
english: The file is too big to attach to my email.

spanish: No tengo un cargador, así que no puedo enchufar mi computadora portátil.
english: I don't have a charger, so I can't plug my laptop in.
I don't have a charger, so I can't plug in my laptop.

spanish: La máquina fue construida en Alemania.
english: The machine was built in Germany.

spanish: La máquina fue construida en 1900.
english: The machine was built in 1900.

spanish: ¿Cuál es tu nombre de usuario?
english: What is your username?

spanish: Haga clic dos veces para abrir el archivo.
english: Click twice to open the file.

spanish: Nosotros vamos a llegar tarde.
english: We are going to be late

spanish: Nosotros vamos a llegar tarde.
english: We are going to be late

spanish: Cuál es tu aplicación favorita?
english: What is your favorite application?

spanish: ¿Qué tan alto es él?
english: How tall is he?

spanish: Mide seis pies de altura.
english: He is six feet tall.

spanish: ¿Qué tan pesado es tu equipaje?
english: How heavy is your luggage?

spanish: ¿Cuál es tu peso?
english: What is your weight?

spanish: Por favor, infórmenos de su llegada.
english: Please inform us of your arrival.

spanish: Hay espacio en la primera fila.
english: There is space in the front row.

spanish: Podemos cuidar de nosotras mismas.
Podemos cuidar de nosotros mismos.
english: We can look after ourselves.

spanish: ¿Tienes medicina para el dolor de estómago?
english: Do you have medicine for a stomachache?

spanish: No comió comida saludable cuando estuvo de vacaciones.
english: He did not eat healthy food when he was on vacation.

spanish: Llene un formulario para cada niño.
english: Fill out a form for each child.

spanish: Leí en la portada que hoy están en la corte.
english: I read on the front page that they are in court today.

spanish: Sus crímenes están siempre en los titulares.
english: Their crimes are always in the headlines.

spanish: Mira la foto en la portada del periódico.
english: Look at the photo on the front page of the newspaper.

spanish: Mira la foto en la portada del periódico.
english: Look at the photo on the front page of the newspaper.

spanish: La noticia más importante está en la portada.
Las noticias más importante está en la portada.
english: The most important news is on the front page.

spanish: No te pongas demasiado perfume.
english: Don't put on too much perfume.

spanish: la camara es igual a la tuya?
english: Is the camera the same as yours?

spanish: Ella quiere probárselos.
english: She wants to try them on.

spanish: Es diferente a su hermana.
english: He is different from his sister.
phrases.detail: In formal writing, 'different from' is generally preferred over 'different than'. 'From' has been used with the verb 'differ' since at least the 1500s, which paved the way for 'different from' to be readily accepted into the lexicon

spanish: Él me sonrió.
english: He smiled at me.

spanish: Él te sonrió.
english: He smiled at you.

spanish: Ellos te sonrieron.
english: They smiled at you

spanish: El aceptó tu invitación a tu fiesta.
english: He accepted your invitation to your party.

spanish: El aceptó tu invitación al evento.
english: He accepted your invitation to the event.

spanish: Tony planea probar el esquí este invierno.
english: Tony is planning to give skiing a try this winter.

spanish: Intentalo.
english: Give it a try.
Give it a shot.
phrases.detail: Definition: to do something in order to find out what happens or to find out whether something is good, suitable, effective etc

spanish: Abre tu libro en la página 5.
english: Open your book to page 5.

spanish: Estoy deseando conocerte.
english: I look forward to meeting you.
I'm looking forward to meeting you.

spanish: Como si me importara.
english: As if I cared.

spanish: Hace calor al sol pero está fresco a la sombra.
english: It is hot in the sun but cool in the shade.

spanish: Retira lo dicho.
Retráctate
english: You take that back.

spanish: ¿Qué película recibió más premios el año pasado?
english: Which film received the most awards last year?
Which movie received the most awards last year?

spanish: Consúltalo con la almohada.
english: Sleep on it.

spanish: ¡Que duermas bien!
english: Sleep tight!

spanish: Tuve un fin de semana tranquilo.
english: I had a quiet weekend.
I had a low-key weekend.

spanish: ¿El precio incluye el envío?
english: Does the price include shipping?

spanish: Trato de planificar con anticipación cuando preparo mis clases.
english: I try to plan ahead when preparing my classes.

spanish: He estado en una dieta líquida durante algunos días.
He estado unos días con una dieta liquida.
Llevo unos días con una dieta liquida.
english: I have been on a liquid diet for a few days.
I have been on a liquid diet for some days.

spanish: Tengo un título en ciencias.
english: I have a degree in science.

spanish: Supe de tu nuevo auto.
english: I heard about your new car.

spanish: ¿Dónde se enteró de eso?
¿Dónde te enteraste de eso?
¿Dónde supiste acerca de eso?
english: Where did you hear about that?

spanish: Enseño español a cambio de lecciones de inglés gratis.
english: I teach Spanish in exchange for free English lessons.

spanish: Trabajará para nosotros a cambio de mucho dinero.
english: He will work for us in exchange for a lot of money.

spanish: Permanecerá en la cárcel hasta que vaya a la corte.
english: He will stay in jail until he goes to court.

spanish: Aunque era peligroso, cruzó la frontera.
english: Although it was dangerous, he crossed the border.
Though it was dangerous, he crossed the border.
Even though it was dangerous, he crossed the border.
phrases.detail: Though is more common than although in general and it is much more common than although in speaking. For emphasis, we often use even with though (but not with although).

spanish: ¿Sabes qué día el líder va a los tribunales?
english: Do you know what day the leader goes to court?
Do you know what day the leader is going to court??

spanish: Me dio su suéter a cambio de mi camiseta.
english: He gave me his sweater in exchange for my shirt.

spanish: El dinero fue la causa de todos sus problemas.
english: Money was the cause of all his problems.

spanish: Aunque robó el banco, no fue a la cárcel.
english: Though he robbed the bank, he didn't go to jail.
Although he robbed the bank, he didn't go to jail.
Even though he robbed the bank, he didn't go to jail.

spanish: El niño pequeño está delante de nosotros en la fila.
english: The little boy is ahead of us in line.

spanish: ¿Sigues en contacto con ella?
english: Are you still in contact with her?

spanish: Hay más de mil millones de personas en Asia.
english: There are over one billion people in Asia.
There are over a billion people in Asia.

spanish: Todavía estoy en contacto con Julia.
english: I am still in contact with Julia.
I am still in touch with Julia.

spanish: Tengo que ponerme en contacto con el banco y arreglar un sobregiro.
english: I must get in touch with the bank and arrange an overdraft.
I must get in contact with the bank and arrange an overdraft.

spanish: Soy alergico a las nueces.
english: I'm allergic to nuts.

spanish: Date prisa y vístete para ir a clase.
Date prisa y vístete para la clase.
english: Hurry up and get dressed for class.
Hurry up and dress for class.

spanish: ¿Cuánto tardará en cruzar el océano?
english: How long will it take to cross the ocean?
bold: How long will it take to

spanish: ¿Cuál es el significado de esta palabra?
english: What is the meaning of this word?

spanish: El es responsable de la salud y la seguridad.
english: He is responsible for health and safety.
He is accountable for health and safety.

spanish: Soy adicta al chocolate.
english: I am addicted to chocolate.
I'm a chocolate addict.

spanish: Está casado con el director.
english: He is married to the director.

spanish: Él tiene experiencia en diseño.
english: He is experienced in design.

spanish: Ella siempre es educada con todas.
english: She is always polite to everyone.

spanish: El tren está llegando a la estación.
english: The train is pulling into the station.
The train is arriving at the station.

spanish: Te veo luego.
english: See you later.

spanish: Prefiero el té al café.
english: I prefer tea to coffee.

spanish: Prefiero un bolígrafo azul a un bolígrafo rojo.
english: I prefer a blue pen to a red pen.

spanish: Trata de ser agradable.
english: Try to be pleasant.

spanish: No tiene sentido.
english: It makes no sense.
It doesn't make sense.

spanish: Lo hice porque sí.
english: I did it just because.

spanish: Está casada con un médico.
english: She is married to a doctor.

spanish: A veces va a pie al trabajo.
A veces camina al trabajo.
english: She walks to work sometimes.

spanish: No le hagas caso.
english: Don't take notice of him.
Don't take notice of her.

spanish: Lo he hecho.
english: I have done so.
I have done it.

spanish: ¿Estás a la altura de las circunstancias?
english: Are you up to the task?
I have done it.
phrases.definition: To be "up to the task" means to have the ability, motivation, and desire to do something difficult.

spanish: Salimos a toda prisa.
english: We left in a hurry.

spanish: Ella está comprometida con Daniel.
english: She is engaged to Daniel.

spanish: Acordamos pagar el auto en cuotas.
english: We agreed to pay for the car in installments.

spanish: Estuve fuera por tres semanas.
english: I was away for three weeks.

spanish: El precio es para visitantes mayores de 65 años.
english: The price is for visitor 65 and over.

spanish: Estoy apurado.
english: I am in a hurry.

spanish: Nosotras estamos de vacaciones
english: We are on vacation.

spanish: Suelo quedarme despierto hasta tarde.
english: I usually stay up late.

spanish: Se lo haré saber.
english: I will let him know.

spanish: Siempre se sale con la suya.
english: He always gets his way.

spanish: Siempre me salgo con la mía.
english: I always get my way.

spanish: Siempre te sales con la tuya.
english: You always get your way.

spanish: ¿Tu hija se siente mejor?
english: Does your daughter feel better?
Is your child feeling better?

spanish: ¿Por qué Wall Street se está apoderando de casas familiares?
english: Why is Wall Street snapping up family homes?

spanish: ¿Está la reunión en el calendario?
english: Is the meeting on the schedule?

spanish: Ha practicado hockey todos los días desde entonces.
english: He has practiced hockey every day since then.

spanish: ¿Has visto al hombre en el póster?
english: Have you seen the man on the poster?

spanish: Mi amiga y yo tenemos la misma edad.
Mi amigo y yo tenemos la misma edad.
english: My friend and I are the same age.

spanish: Es una persona muy amable.
english: He is a very kind person.

spanish: La tormenta le costó a la ciudad miles de millones de dólares.
english: The storm cost the city billions of dollars.

spanish: Nadie estaba sentado en la primera fila de la clase.
english: No one was sitting in the front row of the class.
Nobody was sitting in the first row of the class.

spanish: Estoy muy emocionada por la nueva casa.
english: I am really excited about the new house.

spanish: No soy bueno dibujando.
english: I'm not good at drawing

spanish: Puede planear dejar de trabajar.
english: You can plan on stopping work.

spanish: Reprobé el examen de biología.
english: I failed the biology exam.
I failed the biology test.

spanish: Estoy a cargo de la fiesta de la oficina este año.
english: I am in charge of the office party this year.

spanish: La casa está protegida por tres alarmas.
english: The house is protected by three alarms.

spanish: Usualmente nos reunimos en el gimnasio.
english: We usually meet up at the gym.

spanish: Usualmente nos reunimos en el gimnasio.
english: We usually meet up at the gym.

spanish: Salí del trabajo a las cuatro.
english: I got off work at four o'clock.

spanish: Ellas pospusieron el crucero hasta el día siguiente.
english: They put off the cruise until the next day.
They postponed the cruise until the next day.

spanish: Odio no saber el precio.
english: I hate not knowing the price.

spanish: Él está comprando una bicicleta hoy.
english: He is shopping for a bicycle today.
He is shopping for a bike today.
He is buying a bike today.

spanish: Es lo que es.
english: It is what it is.
phrases.definition: Idiom: used to say that a situation cannot be changed and must be accepted.

spanish: ¿Cómo es la nueva contadora?
english: What is the new accountant like?

spanish: Te daremos un aventón.
english: We'll give you a ride.

spanish: Cambié de opinión.
english: I changed my mind.

spanish: Estaba de vacaciones.
english: I was on vacation.

spanish: Es la que más fans tiene.
english: She has the most fans.

spanish: Amanece a eso de las 7 am.
english: It gets light at about 7 am.

spanish: Solo está lloviznando.
english: It's just drizzling.
It's only drizzling.

spanish: Es bueno estar en casa.
english: It's good to be home.

spanish: Llegó tarde.
Apareció tarde.
english: He turned up late.

spanish: Se enorgullece de su trabajo.
english: He takes pride in his work.

spanish: Me enorgullezco de mi trabajo.
english: I take pride in my work.

spanish: ¿Llamaste antes de tiempo?
¿Llamaste con anticipación?
english: Did you call ahead of time?
Did you call in advance?

spanish: Perdón por llegar tarde.
english: Sorry for being late.

spanish: El papel se hace con madera.
english: Paper is made from wood.

spanish: Estaba bajo la influencia de drogas recreativas en el momento del accidente.
english: He was under the influence of recreational drugs at the time of the accident.
bold: at the time of the accident

spanish: John se creía intocable.
english: John fancied himself untouchable.

spanish: Me enfurecí cuando me insultó.
english: I flared up when he insulted me.
phrases.definition: flare up: to become very angry.

spanish: He tenido tan poco tiempo desde que llegué aquí.
english: I have been so time-poor since I arrived here.
phrases.definition: time-poor: Spending most of one's time working or busy; lacking free time.

spanish: ¿Alguna vez ha sentido que le faltaba tiempo?
¿Alguna vez te has sentido falto de tiempo?
english: Have you ever felt time-poor?
phrases.definition: time-poor: Spending most of one's time working or busy; lacking free time.

spanish: Tengo experiencia en ingeniería de software.
english: I have a background in software engineering.

spanish: Estoy dispuesto a intentarlo.
english: I am willing to give it a try.

spanish: Estaba dispuesto a admitir que estaba equivocado.
english: He was willing to admit he was wrong.

spanish: ¡Ya le he ganado dos veces y quiere jugar otra vez!
english: I've already beaten him twice and he wants to play again.

spanish: El club me interesó al principio, pero me aburrí.
english: The club interested me at first, but I got bored.

spanish: Te interesará saber que las fechas han cambiado.
english: It will interest you to know that the dates have changed.

spanish: ¡Te vas a congelar! ¡Ve a traer una chaqueta!
english: You're going to freeze! Go get a jacket.
